programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond compete in a land race from Resolute, Canada, to the North Pole in their most ambitious challenge to date. Pitting horse power against dog power they travel 450 miles across mountainous land masses and jagged sea ice at temperatures as low as minus 65C.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Driving up Madagascar's eastern coast at the tail end of the rainy season is enough to test the best of friendships, but comedy actor Angus Deayton and broadcaster Mariella Frostrup are game enough to take on the challenge, and good enough friends to poke fun at each other along the way. The route has numerous river crossings and the duo face a variety of broken bridges and flimsy ferries as the only way across, while the roads themselves are mired with thick mud. Progress becomes increasingly painful and they are finally forced to spend a night in the car.

Disorientation takes them by surprise as they have to navigate Salar de Uyuni - a salt lake so vast that Buzz Aldrin could see it from space. Their goal is the ancient mountain city of Potosi, whose silver mines financed the Spanish empire in the 16th century and which is almost 5,000 metres above sea level.

programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites Line of Duty star Vicky McClure, comedian and writer Sandi Toksvig and comedian and presenter Josh Widdicombe to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include real ale, hotel leaflets and coat hangers.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and writer Roisin Conaty, footballer-turned-pundit Chris Kamara and comedian and actor Nish Kumar to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include bread at restaurants, downloading music and ex-partners.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Featuring all the thrills and spills from the 2013 Red Bull Soapbox Race in London, as the crews unleash their four-wheeled, motorless creations on a challenging downhill course littered with obstacles.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Matt Lucas, Holly Walsh and Susan Calman join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig opens her post in a post-themed edition. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Actor Mackenzie Crook, wildlife presenter Chris Packham, writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell and comedian Rhod Gilbert join David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with odd personal statements that may or may not be true.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly and Dara O Briain join David Mitchell's team while Barry Cryer and Sue Perkins are captained by Lee Mack, on the panel game where contestants try to fool their opponents into mistaking fact for fiction and vice versa. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Ed Gamble, Milton Jones and Nish Kumar join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry discover which of them is this series' winner.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by presenter Richard Madeley and actor Sanjeev Bhaskar, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes naturalist Kate Humble and comedian Miles Jupp. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: Profile of Cardinal Richelieu, who as Louis XIII's diabolical chief minister, was feared and hated thanks to his complex spy network.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: History of the conflict, examining its lasting impact on the political powers that were involved, beginning with a look at 1939 and how different countries were drawn into the war.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Archive footage and personal testimony exploring the early advances made by Germany, Italy and the USSR.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the myth of German invincibility was finally debunked by their defeat at the Battle of Stalingrad. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses 'fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Incredible feats of human endeavour, revealing what people have built, where they've built it, how and why. The first edition explores deep inside the rock on Gibraltar where there's over 55km complex of tunnels, under London, where 21st-century engineering innovation is paving the way for the ultimate super sewer and continues the legacy of Victorian pioneers and reveals the extraordinary subterranean space of one of Europe's largest and most breath-taking natural cave systems - The Postojna Cave in Slovenia.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of becoming a steam locomotive fireman on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she fires-up NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Hampton Court Palace, which started out life as a Tudor palace in 1515 and is famous for being the home of King Henry VIII.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of SchÃ¶nbrunn Palace in Austria, which is located in a 500-acre park and includes an orangery, palm house and one of Europe's oldest zoos.

programme.desc: The German army's Blitzkrieg tactics, which led to the swift conquest of Holland, Belgium and France.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: A focus on the Battle of Britain and the Blitz and the Italian troops entering North Africa.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Underground Worlds

Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: The Royal Palace of Caserta near Naples, Italy, which was created by Luigi Vanvitelli and houses a silk factory that dates back to the 18th century and still functions to this day.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Kensington Palace in London, which began life as an early 17th-century Jacobean mansion before becoming a palace fit for the monarchy, and was the brainchild of Christopher Wren.

programme.desc: Examining the key events of 1941, including the Battle of the Atlantic, the invasion of the USSR, and major battles fought in North Africa and Greece.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: The events that led to the USA joining the Allied forces, and how their arrival altered the course of the war over the following year.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Churchill's plan to attack Germany through Italy. Although considered the simplest military solution, the Allies were to face formidable opposition, while the Americans met the Wehrmacht for the first time. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Performances by punk and new wave acts on the music show in 1977, including the Stranglers and the Jam, plus the continuing power of disco exemplified by Donna Summer's I Feel Love, the reggae of Bob Marley and pub rock by acts such as Eddie and the Hot Rods. Insight into performing on the programme comes from musicians including John Otway, JJ Burnel of the Stranglers, Paul Cook of the Sex Pistols, members of Darts and the Adverts, as well as contributions from Nicky Wire, Alexis Petridis and Pete Paphides.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Documentary about the change of musical direction in 1978, when pop singles were slowly ousted by disco, punk and new wave artists. The programme features contributions by members of the Boomtown Rats, Squeeze, Boney M and Sham 69 - among others - and archive performances by the likes of Elvis Costello, the Undertones, Ian Dury and the Blockheads and the Jam.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates the first of three special editions of the archive music show focusing on 1960s hits, beginning with tracks by artists including the Foundations, Julie Driscoll, Sandie Shaw and Procol Harum.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archives, focusing on hits of the 1960s. Featured artists include Clodagh Rodgers, the Move, Tom Jones and the Bee Gees, plus more from Top of the Pops and other shows from the era. Narrated by Mark Radcliffe.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At South Devon, engineer Ray Lee is working to bring a loco back in to service. There is also a visit to the SS Kingswear paddle steamer In Dartmouth, the oldest vessel of its kind.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Neuschwanstein Castle in the Alps of southern Germany. Created for eccentric king Ludwig the second in the 19th century, the castle is both a visual and engineering marvel that was an influence on Walt Disney. Containing a huge throne room and man-made cave, it took 17 years to build but was never fully completed after Ludwig was deposed, incarcerated and mysteriously died in 1868.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: A look at Edinburgh Castle - a symbol of Scottish might that has been besieged more than 20 times and has existed in many guises, including a military fortress, prison and palace.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Examining the advance of Japanese forces across the Pacific and the bombing of German cities by the RAF.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: The key events of 1942, which saw the beginning of the Battle of Stalingrad and the Solomon Islands campaign, and an escalation of the fighting in North Africa.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Meat Loaf: In and Out of Hell
programme.desc: A profile of the rock star's life and career, reflecting on the music that propelled him to fame and charting his journey from an overweight, bullied child to his larger-than-life persona and icon status. Featuring an interview and performance by the singer, as well as backstage footage from a Las Vegas concert. The film also revisits the Dallas of Meat Loaf's early years and includes insights from high school friends who reveal where the unusual moniker really came from.

programme.title: The Rolling Stones at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression.

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.

programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.

programme.title: Underground Worlds

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Train Truckers

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the East Lancashire Railway, the annual Race the Train event gets under way - with athletes of all abilities taking on the 11-mile course from Bury to Rawtenstall.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look through the corridors of power in 10 of the most opulent and historic royal residences on Earth.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces

programme.title: War Above the Trenches

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The story of Zofia Potocka, the lover of Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin, who ran a successful spy network in the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds' nests to the death's-head hawkmoth stealing honey.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that 'talk' to bees using electrical signals.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities

programme.title: Big in America: British Hits in the USA
programme.desc: Compilation of British rock 'n' roll acts in performance, featuring songs that crossed over to the US charts. From the Dave Clark Five to Coldplay, the Brits have rocked America and sometimes even done better across the pond than on home soil. A Flock of Seagulls, Supertramp and Bush also feature, alongside darker British global exports like Black Sabbath and the Cure.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Churchill's Secret Son
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Tipperary-born businessman and Conservative cabinet minister Brendan Bracken, who became Winston Churchill's right-hand man during the Second World War by opposing efforts to appease Adolf Hitler. The film considers the possibility of a biological connection between the two men.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Status Quo play Pictures of Matchstick Men on Top of the Pops in 1968, the Who perform Long Live Rock in the Old Grey Whistle Test studio, Dire Straits deliver Tunnel of Love and Lynyrd Skynyrd bring a taste of the American South with Sweet Home Alabama. The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.desc: Hugh and Penny desperately seek a kidney donor to save Jim's life, Charlie is pursued by an obsessive fan, while Matt and Ajax track down a thief with eyes on their farm.

programme.desc: Sisters Sharon and Tracey's lives are changed for ever when their husbands leave for work and never return. First episode of the popular comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Transatlantic rivalry breaks out when the officers have to share a barracks with a platoon of American soldiers. Starring Jerome Flynn and Gary Love.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers return to the UK and take up guard duty at Windsor Castle, while also preparing to take part in a memorial ceremony for the anniversary of the D-Day landings.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane discovers that Jack's father is taking her to court to gain custody, and Tricia attempts to matchmake Chrissie and Carlos, with disastrous results. Connie passes off Zubin's plans for the future of the hospital as her own ideas and Donna confesses that she's been sleeping in the relatives' room.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As all attempts to locate Abi Nixon prove fruitless, Sam begins to panic - could her daughter have been abducted, committed suicide or even faked her own death? Terry hands in his resignation to Ramani and wrestles with demons from his past as his brother Ben confesses that he too had been sexually abused as a child. Yvonne gives troubled teenager Shirley a stern lecture after she steals money from Dean, only to bite her tongue on learning the wayward youngster has been diagnosed HIV-positive.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry tracks down the paedophile who abused him as a child and, enraged by the old man's lack of remorse, resorts to physical violence. Yvonne tries to stop pregnant teenager Shirley selling her baby, but her well-meaning intervention has unexpected and potentially tragic consequences. Debbie learns her nanny has been hiding a shocking secret and Phil consoles Samantha, who is now convinced her missing daughter Abi has been abducted.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank's looking for a babysitter, Grant's hiding something inedible in the fridge and Ian wants to inject some drama into the season.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant's Boxing Day surprise doesn't have quite the effect he'd planned. Sharon hears Grant has arranged their wedding for today and is furious. Michelle is fed up with Vicki's doll.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia is concerned during a visit as she feels new mum Pamela is overly anxious, so Dr Turner arranges for a psychiatrist to come in. However, they soon discover both mother and baby have gone missing. Meanwhile, Jenny, on secondment, begins to see cracks in the establishment, Chummy discovers her mother has walked out on her father, and Trixie struggles to hide her disappointment when Tom cancels a date. Guest starring Sophie Rundle (The Bletchley Circle).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is assigned to first-time mother Jeanette, who requires frequent visits during a protracted labour, and when she meets her patient's cousin, Philip, a new friendship begins to grow for the midwife. Meanwhile, Chummy worries about her mother's illness when she discovers Lady Browne has discharged herself from hospital. Jessica Raine and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara faces her most challenging case so far when she treats a first-time mother, only for the birth not to go according to plan. A new nurse arrives and soon makes an impression on Sister Evangelina, while Sister Julienne is worried about the increasing financial pressure on Nonnatus House, but doesn't bank on a mystery benefactor coming to the rescue. Jenny Agutter and Pam Ferris star, with Linda Bassett (East Is East) joining the cast.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is looking forward to the pitter-patter of tiny feet - despite the fact that daughter Judith is not even pregnant.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The circus brings death to Kembleford when a clown is murdered, and Father Brown hunts the killer while trying to determine why a parishioner has agreed to marry the sinister wizard Welkin. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

credits.actor: Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A fashion show takes a chilling turn when young model Zoe Mackay is strangled just moments after leaving the catwalk, and while the crew and other models come under suspicion, they all have watertight alibis. To make matters worse, there are no witnesses or DNA evidence, the only clue being a single stocking clasped in the victim's hand. What does it mean - and how was her killer able to strike without being spotted? Meanwhile, Florence tries to help Humphrey improve his social skills with the opposite sex, and JP recognises one of the models as a school crush on at school. But will she remember him?.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ex-convict is found murdered in his home and suspicion immediately lands on a recently released child killer. Nikki and the Lyell team are introduced to forensic psychologist Sasha Blackburn, who works closely with those released from prison on licence, as both the victim and one of the suspects are clients of hers. The investigators soon learn that it is not just the minds of these young men that are fragile, but their freedom is too. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, guest starring Lyndsey Marshal and Niamh Cusack.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny is heartbroken when Hugh makes a series of disastrous choices about his marriage and career, while love is in the air on Hayley and Ajax's wedding day.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A football match is cut short when trouble arises. Elsewhere, Nelson has problems with his girlfriend, and Paddy faces a few home truths.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The day of Major Kieran Voce and Captain Kate Butler's wedding arrives. Meanwhile, Donna Tucker starts to get closer to her tutor.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin arranges for Ric to be reunited with his estranged son, a situation that becomes complicated when it transpires his girlfriend is six months pregnant and hooked on drugs. When she goes into premature labour, it falls to Jess and Zubin to save the baby. Connie leaves Will to handle an emergency heart operation on his own, but Mickie comes to the rescue, displaying surprising surgical skills. Former EastEnders actress Lucy Speed guest stars as a patient expecting quads.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry tracks down the paedophile who abused him as a child and, enraged by the old man's lack of remorse, resorts to physical violence. Yvonne tries to stop pregnant teenager Shirley selling her baby, but her well-meaning intervention has unexpected and potentially tragic consequences. Debbie learns her nanny has been hiding a shocking secret and Phil consoles Samantha, who is now convinced her missing daughter Abi has been abducted.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani fears Terry has taken the law into his own hands when both he and Malcolm Willard go missing, but it seems the aged paedophile has more to fear from Terry's brother Ben, who is also looking for revenge. Irene Radford issues dire threats after her son Wayne is found dead in his cell, apparently from an overdose, while Neil reprimands Andrea for breaking regulations - only to end up in a passionate embrace with her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline and Arthur are still reeling from Mark's revelation, while Michelle and Clyde decide to tackle some unfinished business between them.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark is determined that Michelle shouldn't be let into the family secret, but Pauline has other ideas.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is gripped by an outbreak of dysentery, but that's the least of mum-to-be Marie Amos's worries when her husband Tony is arrested for gross indecency in the gentlemen's toilets and faces a criminal hearing. Nurse Crane meets Dolores McEvoy, a pregnant Irish woman who is clearly malnourished - but when she visits the woman's home, it turns out she has given a false address and has disappeared. Trixie is delighted when Tom asks her to oversee her first official church duty since their engagement, while at Nonnatus House, Fred tackles a rat infestation - only for Sister Monica Joan to work against him. With guest appearances by Cara Theobold (Downton Abbey) and Richard Fleeshman (Coronation Street).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Winifred's eyes are opened to Poplar's seedy underworld when she cares for expectant prostitute Bridget Cole. Horrified by the young woman's lack of awareness, she draws on her teaching experience, and with help from Sgt Noakes sets out to promote safe sex to all local working girls. Barbara struggles to understand why expectant father Frank Robbins would pressure his wife to bear him a son, while Sister Monica Joan is feeling sidelined - until she finds herself unexpectedly assisting Shelagh with an emergency birth. Trixie invites herself along to a meeting between Tom and the Bishop - but things get tense when the idea of the couple moving to Newcastle is raised.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A Christian Scientist couple refuse medicine for their newborn baby, leaving Sister Julienne questioning the nature of absolute faith. However, the case becomes more complicated when the parents are accused of harming their child. Barbara uses her initiative to communicate with a pregnant Sylheti woman who cannot speak English, although using the patient's young son to translate provides new problems. Sister Mary Cynthia returns to Nonnatus House and a woman catches handyman Fred's eye.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A diabetic teenager faces a tough time after falling pregnant, a situation complicated by her boyfriend's criminal past. Nurse Crane offers what support she can - but the girl's life is endangered when the young lovers go on the run. A case of petty theft brings a group of Irish travellers to the attention of the midwives, who end up treating a newborn infant and looking after an expectant mother, and it seems Fred's romance is on the up when he asks Violet to accompany him to a fundraising dance.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel are eager for Sandy and Harry's return from Canada.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.sub-title: The Sign of the Broken Sword
programme.desc: A murder is committed at the local army barracks using a legendary broken sword, and the incident leads the priest to investigate another death at Dunkirk 13 years previously. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Dwayne attends the funeral of local barber Cedrik Verga and shortly after is puzzled to receive a message from beyond the grave - a text from the deceased claiming 'I was murdered'. Given that his phone was in the coffin, is this a sick prank or something altogether more sinister? Humphrey agrees to investigate, and they soon find evidence to rule out his death from natural causes. Meanwhile, Humphrey demonstrates his culinary skills to Florence and the rest of the team.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The accidental fatal shooting of a Polish teenager in an armed police operation sparks a series of murders, which links Turkish gangsters, a grieving family and a fractured firearms unit. As the inquest delivers a lawful killings verdict, IPCC investigator Vicky Sharpe calls on the Lyell team to investigate the connection between the events and review the police evidence, but Sharpe's relationship with the family of the teenager and her suspicion of the firearms division lead Nikki and Thomas to distrust her motives. Feature-length episode, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh faces chaos at home and work, with a mutiny on the farm following a drunken evening and a deadly pregnancy crisis with Hayley.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: The opening of Hugh's new cardiac clinic is upset by life-changing news from his ex-wife, and Charlie's life is thrown into disarray when her father makes a visit.

programme.desc: Sharon spreads her wings and takes full advantage of her sister's hospitality, but Tracey is having money worries. Ross Kemp guest stars, with Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy Garvey is awarded his medal at Buckingham Palace, and an old flame returns into Major James McCudden's life. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The men take part in a training exercise in dealing with chemical weapons, and the arrival of a new soldier in the regiment brings trouble.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie has received a string of complaints about Will, and puts him under observation for the day. Her concerns seem to be confirmed when he accuses a seriously ill patient of faking her symptoms - only to see her collapse in the wards and her husband threaten legal action. Chrissie urges Tricia to ask Carlos out, the tension rises between Jess and Zubin and Owen is determined to prove how committed he is to Diane and the baby.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani fears Terry has taken the law into his own hands when both he and Malcolm Willard go missing, but it seems the aged paedophile has more to fear from Terry's brother Ben, who is also looking for revenge. Irene Radford issues dire threats after her son Wayne is found dead in his cell, apparently from an overdose, while Neil reprimands Andrea for breaking regulations - only to end up in a passionate embrace with her.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Things look grim for Adam as the day of his trial dawns, until Andrea and Neil manage to expose Jerome Taylor's dirty dealings, while investigations into the death of paedophile Malcolm Willard raise the alarming possibility that a serial sniper could be on the loose in Sun Hill. An angry exchange with Shirley adds to Yvonne's woes as she anxiously awaits the results of her HIV tests.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon is close to owning the Queen Vic - until a face returns from the past. Ian attends an auction to bid for the local pizza restaurant and Frank gets himself into a state.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders

programme.desc: A water shortage means that the maternity home is busier than ever and two old schoolmates are reunited, but Marion shuns Shirley's attempts at renewing their friendship until they are brought together later in an unexpected way. Fred thinks about taking the next step in his relationship with Violet. Drama, guest starring Una Stubbs and David Ryall.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie and Sister Mary Cynthia team up to support a deaf mother-to-be, while another patient causes great concern when a case of morning sickness proves more serious than initially suspected. On the personal front, handyman Fred's daughter is less than delighted to hear about his forthcoming wedding. Will he be forced to choose between her and Violet?.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar readies itself for Christmas 1960 with a festive bus trip to see the Regent Street lights, while a visit from a BBC film crew promises to make it a festive holiday to remember. However, it's a difficult time for grieving mother Iris, bringing back memories of her long-departed baby daughter. At Nonnatus, things are tense as Sister Monica Joan determines to bring the Christmas spirit early - despite Sister Evangelina's disgust. As the community prepares for a televised carol concert, it becomes apparent that Sister Monica Joan has gone missing. Jenny Agutter and Judy Parfitt star.

programme.title: An Inspector Calls
programme.desc: Adaptation of JB Priestley's stage play. In 1912, a detective (David Thewlis) arrives in a town where a young woman has committed suicide. Interrupting a wealthy family in the midst of a lavish party, he unravels the events that led to the woman's death - an investigation with devastating repercussions as secrets are exposed and each member of the family realises they have all unwittingly played a part. Also starring Miranda Richardson and Ken Stott.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When Kembleford's new cricket captain is framed for murder, Father Brown must prove his innocence to give his team any chance of beating neighbouring village Hambleston. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey is delighted when his Aunt Mary, the woman who inspired his love of puzzle-solving, arrives for a visit. But when she becomes the only witness to a fellow tourist's death - seemingly thrown from his hotel balcony in the middle of the night- she finds herself slap bang in the middle of a murder investigation. Meanwhile, JP takes relationship advice from Humphrey after confessing his feelings for Rosey - leaving him more confused than ever. Wendy Craig, Keith Allen and Susie Amy guest star in the island whodunit.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The Lyell team investigates the murder of a family shot while picnicking by a river, and discover the female victim was in the middle of a bitter divorce. Local detective Malcolm Guillam is brought in to help and when the present-day murder reminds him of an unsolved case that haunts him, he sees an opportunity to redeem himself. However, DCI Sally Butcher is convinced that the woman's estranged husband is responsible for the murder and has no time for Guillam's trip down memory lane. Feature-length episode, guest starring Derek Griffiths.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Lizzie must deal with her mother's bold defence of the York cause, while the appearance of a boy in Burgundy claiming to be a young prince threatens to further destabilise King Henry's rule. King Henry's mother Lady Margaret Beaufort faces the consequences of harbouring a dark secret. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Meryl and Carlito's relationship leaves the Knight family reeling, the tension between Hugh and Penny endangers the new cardiac clinic, and Matt reconnects with a high school crush.

programme.title: The Heart Guy

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon has the unpleasant task of telling Pete about the buyer of the Mitchells' flat. Frank is behind with the book-keeping and Arthur has been avoiding Mark as much as possible.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The strain on the Fowler family is beginning to show - it can't be long before something or someone cracks. Will Pete tell Kathy before she hears the news from someone else?.

programme.desc: Easter approaches in the spring of 1961, and Patsy helps to deliver a baby that is born with severe deformities. Her husband struggles to cope with his daughter's needs, but the sisters rally round to support the family. Trixie teaches a keep fit class which results in a medical emergency, leaving her determined to teach her patients to understand their own bodies.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara treats a pregnant woman whose dockworker husband is struggling to support her as opportunities for work dry up. She is forced into a difficult decision that leaves Barbara facing the biggest test of her career. Nurse Crane meets a kindred spirit when she learns to speak Spanish, and Sister Evangelina helps a woman with breastfeeding, leading to unforeseen consequences.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A rare disease spreads around Poplar Street, and Patsy and Dr Turner try to trace the outbreak to its source. Suspicion over the identity of the first carrier threatens to divide a previously close-knit family. Sister Winifred is forced to confront her prejudices while treating a patient, and Barbara worries about how Trixie will react when she agrees to go to dinner with Tom.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne is seconded to a maternity ward, and is impressed by how modern technology is being used to help the mothers - but is left with a moral dilemma after assisting on a traumatic birth. A young man from Poplar is delighted to be accepted into university, but his mother is less than happy. His dreams are jeopardised when his girlfriend gets pregnant, a development that puts pressure on the whole family.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Patrick searches for his father, while Stephen aspires to be a celebrity.

programme.title: Father Brown

Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The Caribbean cops enter the high-pressure world of fine dining when a famous chef is found stabbed to death the morning after the opening of his new restaurant. It proves to be a tricky investigation as the body was stored in a freezer, so the time of death cannot be identified - and when it turns out he was quite a hot-head in the kitchen, all his staff come under suspicion. Away from the case, Dwayne meets his match in the shape of a troublesome schoolboy, Florence has one last lesson in love for the inspector and JP makes a life-changing decision. Tara FitzGerald and Martin Compston guest star.

programme.desc: A severed finger is brought to the Lyell Centre by DCI Rory Goodchild and immigration enforcement officer Pia Butler, who ask Nikki and Thomas to test for a DNA match with 17 year-old Syrian illegal immigrant Akka Khoury. The teenager was sent the digit by a people-smuggler who claims to have her mother and is demanding money for her safe return. Meanwhile, Akka's 12 year-old cousin Sosa is trying to enter the UK illegally hidden in a van on a cross-channel ferry. Emilia Fox stars.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny gives Hugh an ultimatum about their relationship, while Meryl and Betty land Hugh as their star attraction at the first Whyhope speed dating night.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave loses his temper when Donna tells him the truth about their son. Meanwhile, Stubbs struggles with life as an officer. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New CID recruit DC Suzie Sim makes an impressive debut at Sun Hill by speedily solving a hate crime, but also uncovers alarming evidence that Terry's nephew Bradley could be a victim of abuse. Samantha faces an uphill task convincing her colleagues that Abi has been abducted, while Kerry's uncharacteristic waspishness causes concern and Honey's gossiping about her date with Steve backfires.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Trouble brews in the Square as James Wilmott-Brown returns.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Willmott-Brown says he wants to put right a wrong, but will Kathy give him the chance?.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner and Shelagh are at the forefront of the advances in medical technology, and begin a campaign to ensure better respiratory health for their patients. However, Timothy fears their own lifestyle is not good for them and tries to encourage his parents to give up smoking. Violet injures her back and is forced to leave the shop in Fred's hands, a decision that strengthens their relationship but which proves to have other, unforeseen consequences. A new mother's past comes to light, with devastating repercussions for her family. Nurse Crane draws on her own experiences to help her.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is rocked by a series of violent attacks on women, and a prostitute is too ashamed to report what she knows - but her actions lead to a dangerous man roaming the streets, with devastating consequences for the residents of Nonnatus House. A mother tries to keep her daughter's pregnancy a secret to avoid gossip, putting her life in danger. The Turners go on a long overdue holiday, but the weather ruins their plans.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The introduction of the contraceptive pill is welcomed by Dr Turner, but some of his colleagues are less keen on the idea. Patsy tries to help a bargee who wants to give birth among her own community rather than in a maternity ward. Nurse Crane deals with an emergency during a storm, and a familiar face returns to Nonnatus House - but has been changed by her time away.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is horrified to realise he may be partly to blame as the cause of the recent rise in birth deformities comes to light, and tries to prevent further cases. Sister Evangelina returns to work, but has clearly been affected badly by her stroke, and her health continues to deteriorate. A pregnant bride goes into labour during her wedding reception, while her mother is forced to come to terms with her grandchild being conceived out of wedlock.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel wants peace and quiet, but ends up in hospital along with Patrick, Jean and Stephen.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When the father of a young writer is found dead, tensions mount against the travellers in Kembleford, and the priest races to find out who actually committed the murder before one of them is wrongly sent to the gallows. Starring Mark Williams, Nathalie Buscombe and Philip McGinley.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A marine salvage team unearth the legendary Saint Marie silver, but their celebration comes to an abrupt halt when their captain is found dead on the beach with a stab wound to his chest. With the captain's son Sam, wife Naomi and assistant Addison having watertight alibis, attention turns to rival treasure hunter Newton Farrell. Meanwhile, Dwayne is on best man duty as he organises the ultimate stag party for a terrified JP, and Florence is determined to find out what Humphrey got up to the night before his own wedding. Caribbean crime drama, guest starring Jack Donnelly (Atlantis) and Jill Halfpenny (Humans).

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A schoolteacher disappears and investigating officer DCI Andy Steemson asks Nikki and Jack to examine evidence found at the house, including traces of blood, bike tracks and a charred cake in the oven. Meanwhile, Thomas is called to the site of the murder of a former drug addict and petty criminal who has been thrown from the top of a flyover, and becomes determined to win justice for the victim in the wake of police indifference - forming an unlikely alliance in the process.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, confounding the Tudors, and creating a new rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage. Lizzie faces an impossible choice, and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat to her family. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Ajax takes desperate measures to stop Hugh selling the farm, Penny discovers her perfect match thanks to Meryl's dating service, and Matt gets drunk with April.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: When he learns the identity of the new owner, Hugh tries to stop the farm sale, Matt is torn between his feelings for Charlie and April, and Meryl uncovers council corruption.

programme.desc: Tracey spreads her wings for the first time since her husband was put behind bars, and invites a handsome footballer round for dinner. Meanwhile, Sharon discovers the joys of literature. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1989. The Essex girls steel themselves for a lonely Christmas away from their jailbird husbands. Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson star.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer is arrested on suspicion of armed robbery - and to make matters worse, the only way he can clear his name is by admitting he was with a charming ex-girlfriend at the time. He must decide whether to come clean and face a jealous Charlotte's wrath, or take the consequences of the charge. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A penniless sculptor seeks the canny dealer's help to prise a considerable inheritance out of his avaricious brother. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The police suspect Lovejoy of stealing from one of Jane's old friends, forcing him to enlist the help of refuse collector extraordinaire Brian Nun to clear himself. Unfortunately, matters are complicated by Eric's 'bin diving' habit. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Two mysterious murders appear to be the work of an ancient Mayan curse attached to a statue acquired by Lovejoy. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: The Wind in the Willows
programme.desc: Lavish live-action adaptation of Kenneth Grahame's much-loved children's novel. Matt Lucas stars as Toad, the aristocratic amphibian with a love of fast cars, with Bob Hoskins, Mark Gatiss and Lee Ingleby as his best friends Badger, Rat and Mole, who 'poop-poop' his new hobby when they realise he is becoming a menace to other road-users. However, Mr Toad ignores them, runs away and steals a motor car - for which he gets thrown into prison for 20 years. With no one to look after his stately manor house, the place is overrun with stoats and weasels.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Christmas special of the period drama, which catches up with the nurses and midwives of Nonnatus House in 1962. They receive a letter from a doctor running a mission clinic on the Eastern Cape of South Africa, who is in desperate need of their help to save her urgently needed hospital from closure. The nurses head to Africa to lend a hand, finding the clinic understaffed, underfunded and with a poor water supply, but overwhelmed with patients who need their help more than anyone ever has before. Sinead Cusack guest stars.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives return home after their trip to South Africa, to find Nonnatus House has come under new management. The formidable Sister Ursula (Harriet Walter) has taken charge and introduced some drastic changes to the way the clinic is run, which Sister Julienne, bound by her vow of obedience, is powerless to oppose. The midwives come to the aid of a victim of domestic violence whose husband is about to be released from prison, and who risks losing everything if she seeks a divorce. Sister Mary Cynthia suffers further anxiety attacks, and Patsy receives distressing news about her father.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Ursula insists the midwives do not become emotionally involved with their patients, but her harsh new approach proves hard to cope with in the face of two devastating cases. A father-to-be is badly injured in an explosion, leaving him unable to work to support his family, and a couple with dwarfism expecting their first child are warned that their child may be stillborn, a situation that leaves Patsy confronted with one of the hardest decisions of her life.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The government plans to close down small hospitals in favour of larger establishments. Dr Turner and Shelagh prepare for an inspection that will decide the fate of Nonnatus House - but the staff is shocked to find Sister Ursula has no intention of helping to save the maternity home. Barbara comes to the aid of a woman from the Chinese community who is struggling to get on with her mother-in-law, and whose baby is seriously ill.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest and his friends find themselves stranded with a group of hedonists and are desperate to escape, fearful that their lives are in danger. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

Meanwhile, JP prepares for the biggest day of his life as his wedding day approaches, and when Humphrey bumps into an old lady friend, Florence encourages her boss to pursue his quest for love.

programme.title: Silent Witness

programme.desc: Jack questions the wisdom of Adam's decision to alert the officers to the presence of a serial sniper on the streets of Sun Hill, while undercover journalist Andrea debates whether to cave in to pressure from her editor and deliver a sensationalistic story that could terrify the local population. Steve is unimpressed with Lance's handling of a hostage situation and resorts to extreme measures to express his displeasure.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to re-create a Victorian garden in Regent's Park, where they meet all manner of intriguing characters - but the oasis of calm in central London is shattered by the discovery of a body. The victim is a respected Harley Street psychiatrist - whose three-legged dog appears to hold the key to solving the case. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Annie (1982)
programme.desc: An orphan wins the fatherly affections of a tough-talking billionaire - but the no-good owner of the orphanage and her brother are out to ruin the girl's chances of happiness and make a quick profit in the process. Musical, directed by John Huston, based on the stage play. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Carol Burnett and Tim Curry.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A woman expecting her third child realises she cannot afford to care for her baby, so makes the painful decision to give it away to her wealthy but childless cousin. Shelagh befriends the woman in the next hospital bed and Dr Turner confides in Timothy about his worst fears. Sister Julienne looks for a new recruit to join the midwives, and the community prepares to celebrate the opening of a new park.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A distant cousin of Fred's who has Down's syndrome is taken in by the Buckles following the death of his protective mother, but Violet struggles to cope and Shelagh is forced to make other arrangements for his care. New recruit Valerie prepares for her first day at Nonnatus House, and Trixie comes to the aid of a pregnant woman who is in urgent need of dental treatment to avoid an infection. The nurses discover what has happened to Sister Mary Cynthia, a revelation that has distressing consequences for Sister Monica Joan.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: While the world anxiously awaits the resolution of the Cuban Missile Crisis, Valerie treats a pregnant Somali woman who has undergone female genital circumcision. The Nonnatus Team arrange for her to go into hospital, but she responds by going into hiding, and the situation is complicated further when it emerges that the woman's younger sister will soon go through the same process. Sister Mary Cynthia's depression is treated with electroconvulsive therapy, which she hopes will restore her faith.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is reunited with a couple whose daughter was born without limbs, and takes them to a specialist unit where she can be fitted for prosthetics. However, while the experience helps the girl's mother to realise that she is not alone, it proves traumatic for the father, who blames his wife for his child's condition. Nurse Crane takes charge of Sister Winifred's driving lessons, and Trixie thinks Christopher is hiding something from her.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A body is discovered in a vineyard and Father Brown is tasked with searching for the murderer among a group of suspects who are all seeking to reinvent themselves. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A scientist studying a live volcano is found dead halfway up the mountain, and the evidence points to a heart attack. Humphrey is convinced one of the dead man's colleagues murdered him - an unlikely possibility, since they all have alibis. Away from the investigation, the inspector eagerly awaits Martha's return to the island, while JP settles into married life and Dwayne makes an error of judgment while talking to a journalist. Kris Marshall, Josephine Jobert and Danny John-Jules star in the sun-soaked whodunit, with guest appearances from Douglas Hodge, Natasha Little and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Father and son Bill and Frankie McAteer are killed in an apparent car accident on their way home from work at Billingsgate Market, but Nikki and Jack arrive to discover the younger man's body is riddled with bullets. Back at the Lyell centre, Clarissa summons her husband Max, a digital forensics expert, to help crack the case - and he uncovers disturbing video evidence showing a sexual encounter between Frankie, his girlfriend Becky and best friend Liam. Crime drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives a surprise visit from her father's mistress and is shocked to learn the truth about her financial difficulties, while Evie begins her first day as an apprentice dressmaker. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: Harry falls for jazz club owner Jo Beckett and plans to marry her and invest in the club. He even makes preparations to sell his share of CBS to a rival security firm. Michael Elphick stars in this seasonal episode.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Real Chernobyl
programme.desc: Sky News documentary special meeting people in Ukraine who were involved in the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Hotspots: On the Frontline
