programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby, which puts the love lives of singletons in the hands of the people they know best - their mum and dad. Each week, one man and one woman must choose from three potential partners, with their decisions solely based on an encounter with the contestants' parents.

programme.title: What Would Be Your Miracle?
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the stories of people whose lives are being transformed by modern medicine, and follows them as they make their wildest dreams come true. In the opening episode, Emma meets Adele and Ashley from Aberdare, Wales, who are desperate to see their son Garin, who has cerebral palsy, walk for the first time. Now, thanks to surgery in America, there's every chance their dream could come true. And if it does, Garin has one further dream - to play football. Plus, the story of Lancashire woman Andrea, who has been deaf since childhood but is now also going blind. Will a cochlear implant allow her to hear for the first time in decades?.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter introduces a guide to this year's must-have toys, and Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy and his wife Rebekah join five families in trying out the latest board games. Phillip competes against racing driver Billy Monger in a remote control car road test, Stacey Solomon checks out fancy dress costumes for children, and children recommend presents under Â£15.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the apparent suicide of a solicitor rumoured to have been stealing money from clients. When rival lawyer Otto Benham is later found murdered in a bizarre manner, the detectives begin to suspect the two deaths may be related. Mystery, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Barry Jackson, James Weber Brown and Oliver Ford Davies.

programme.title: The Mummy Returns (2001)
programme.desc: Married explorers Rick and Evelyn battle the newly resurrected mummy Imhotep and his ruthless partner, who have captured their son. The undead creature is heading for a confrontation with a legendary ancient warrior - with power over a magical army to be won. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr and Patricia Velasquez, with a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson.

credits.actor: a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: The Santa Clause (1994)
programme.desc: A grumpy divorced father faces a dilemma one Christmas Eve after accidentally startling Santa and causing him to fall to his death. The guilty man's only option is to put on the red suit, jump into the sleigh and finish the round himself, much to his son's delight. Fantasy comedy, starring Tim Allen, Judge Reinhold, Wendy Crewson, Eric Lloyd and David Krumholtz.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win Â£50,000

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Anton Du Beke, Alistair McGowan, Sarah-Jane Crawford and Adrian Edmondson pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: As the locals prepare for Christmas Day, Leyla's hopes are raised, Rhona feels guilty about leaving, and Kim has a proposal for Marlon.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Nick and Sarah unveil the refurbished factory to the staff, keeping quiet about Derek's change of heart, while Sean reveals to an appalled Fiz that Jade is living on the streets. Rita tells Gemma she has arranged to visit Mavis over Christmas, despite the fact she has no plans to go anywhere. Emma and Seb become a couple, but will Alina ruin their romance?.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin finds out about the festive ingredients to be found in Cheshire's Delamere Forest, and Ben Fogle is at Castle Howard in North Yorkshire - one of the grand settings of ITV's Victoria - to help with the renovation of its gold dome. There is also one last visit to Yorkshire Dales shepherdess Amanda Owen as the farm prepares for winter and her children get ready for Christmas.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary lies to Maria that Derek ran into financial trouble, so he swooped in to save the factory and the workers' jobs. Later, he locks a tied-up Derek in the furniture shop overnight, determined to make sure he misses his flight to Florida with his kids. Fiz and Tyrone find Jade on Victoria Street and drag her back to No 9 and, while Rita decorates her tree alone, Emma informs Seb that Alina came looking for him.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Christmas Road Trip - Three Unwise Men
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix reconvene after their European travels to rediscover the spirit of Christmas, heading to the unlikely festive destination of Morocco to see what the North African country has to offer in the way of culture, cuisine and adventure. The trio journey through the Agafay desert by camel, on through the mountains and end up deep in Marrakesh's marketplace and souks, with their trip culminating in a festive feast inspired by their travels, the people they have met and the experiences they have had.

programme.title: Gremlins (1984)
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Killer from the Abyss - Part One
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade takes on the biggest investigation of his career - to unravel what happened to the passengers of the RMS Laconia, torpedoed in the mid-Atlantic.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter takes a look at the best Christmas deals on food and drink. The stars of The Real Housewives of Cheshire take a blind taste test to see if they can tell the difference between supermarket sparkling wine and real champagne. Mother and daughter Janet Ellis and Sophie Ellis-Bextor get to grips with some 1970s-style retro kitchen appliances, and Matt Tebbutt samples Phillip's efforts with a DIY home gin-making kit.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The naked body of a business executive is found dumped in a rival factory's steriliser machine, leaving Barnaby and Scott with a complicated mystery to unravel. Their investigation begins with factory owners the Plummers, who seem to be hiding more than their share of secrets. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Annette Crosbie and Jasper Britton.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill opens his diary to look at a typical year in the life of a You've Been Framed! star, taking in all the major events in the calendar, from Pancake Day disasters to horrific Halloweens.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: How The Grinch Stole Christmas (2000)
programme.desc: A little girl residing in the Christmas-obsessed town of Whoville becomes fascinated with a grouchy creature living in the mountains. But her efforts to make him part of their celebrations leave him more bitter than ever, and he resolves to ruin the festive season. Fantasy comedy, based on Dr Seuss's children's book, with Jim Carrey, Taylor Momsen, Jeffrey Tambor and Molly Shannon. Anthony Hopkins narrates.

programme.title: Santa Claus: The Movie (1985)
programme.desc: An impulsive elf walks out on Father Christmas during the hectic preparations for the festive season, and heads for New York determined to make a name for himself. However, he falls into the clutches of an evil toy manufacturer, who has a devilish money-making plan up his sleeve. Family fantasy adventure, starring Dudley Moore, John Lithgow, David Huddleston, Burgess Meredith and Judy Cornwell.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Elf (2003)
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: While Graham receives some important results, Kim's blood runs cold and Nate feels isolated.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: One of the most enjoyable things for viewers of The Chase is watching Bradley Walsh collapse in a fit of giggles after pronouncing a question wrong, or when a rude-sounding name crops up - or taking a contestant to one side to give them a telling-off if they get too big for their boots. Here, the host presents a third selection of these and other such unscripted moments and out-takes from the teatime quiz show.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary frees Derek from his bonds, and Fiz calls at the furniture shop to drop off items from a house clearance, including a live antique gun. In the Rovers, a drunk Ali vows to win back Maria and see Gary get his comeuppance. Elsewhere, Marion rails at Shona and David for banning Max from seeing her.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes another batch of celebrity guests to his famous green room for a special Christmas edition of the talk show. He is joined by David Tennant, whose demonic role in Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman's Good Omens will be coming to BBC in the new year, as well as singers Rita Ora and Jamie Cullum, former X Factor judge Sharon Osbourne, Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two presenter Rylan Clark-Neal, award-winning Hollywood star David Oyelowo and comedian Bec Hill.

programme.title: Not the Robbie Williams Christmas Show
programme.desc: In a one-off special recorded at London's Alexandra Palace Theatre, the singer performs classic hits, plus new Christmas songs. He's also joined by guests including David Walliams and Jamie Cullum.

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: A festive special in which Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness team up to remake Joe Dante's 1984 horror comedy Gremlins. Original star Zach Galligan helps out as they tackle the story of a cute little creature given as a Christmas present, but which spawns a horde of murderous little monsters after an accidental dowsing with water, with appearances by Kara Tointon, John Thomson, Su Pollard, Les Dennis and Arthur Bostrom..

programme.title: Carols at Christmas 2019
programme.desc: Myleene Klass leads the congregation of St Elisabeth's Church, Stockport in a traditional Christmas Eve carol service. The celebrations include festive performances from singer-songwriter KT Tunstall, musical theatre group Collabro, big-band crooner Mark Kingswood and West End star Marisha Wallace.

programme.title: Casino Royale (1967)
programme.desc: Ageing spy James Bond comes out of retirement to tackle a mysterious mastermind who wants to take over the world. Meanwhile, another agent disguises himself as Bond to face the evil genius over the baccarat table. Spoof spy adventure, starring David Niven, Peter Sellers, Woody Allen, Orson Welles, Deborah Kerr and Ursula Andress.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Make It Pop
programme.desc: Adventures with good friends and room-mates Sun Hi Song and Corki Chang.

programme.title: Wishfart
programme.desc: The city is overtaken by terrifying and delicious hordes of gingerdead cookies. As the trio take shelter, they realise that they must find the cause of the disaster.

programme.title: NinjaGo: Masters of Spinjitzu Wu's Teas Shorts
programme.desc: Cole has been tasked by Master Wu to sweep the shop clean of dust. Only the problem is, the dust is alive and fighting back.

programme.title: The Bagel and Becky Show
programme.desc: Bagel loses his precious house key in a massive snow drift. Offbeat animated comedy following a mis-matched brother and sister as they stumble into outlandish situations.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, a Christmas volunteer in a supermarket, thinks a burglar is entering overnight and decides to stop him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo forgets to include Mr Cat in his letter to Santa! To make amends he follows Weasel, dressed as an elf, who leads him to the AeroFizz..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Magoo mistakes Weasel for a tuna being pursued by a fisherman..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: It's cold, the boiler is broken, and Mr. Bean has to get warm, fast..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Summer rears its hot, cheeky head in Grimsby but Dave has found a way to keep the Spud flat nice and cool. Maybe too cool..

programme.title: Scooby-Doo! Haunted Holidays (2012)
programme.desc: The cowardly hound and his Mystery Machine companions find their winter holidays interrupted when a sinister living snowman begins to torment the owners of a local toy store. However, as Scooby and the gang investigate, they find themselves trapped within the shop's factory, with their frozen adversary lying in wait. Animated mystery adventure, with the voice of Matthew Lillard.

programme.title: Disney's A Christmas Carol (2009)
programme.desc: A foul-tempered Victorian miser who hates the festive season is visited on Christmas Eve by a series of ghosts. The spirits intend to make him mend his wicked ways by showing him visions of the past, the present and what the future will hold for him if he does not change for the better. Animated fantasy based on Charles Dickens' novel, featuring motion-captured performances by Jim Carrey and Gary Oldman.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: The programme explores what makes this time of the year so special in Britain's countryside. Ben Fogle climbs Helvellyn with a man who battles the elements in the Lake District every day, while Paul Heiney views the Peak District from a glider and Liz Bonnin witnesses thousands of swans begin their journey from the fens of Cambridgeshire to their winter home in Russia.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At a Christmas family get-together, a cracker riddle states two people will die before midnight on Boxing Day, and just a few hours later family matriarch Lydia meets an untimely end - giving Barnaby the perfect reason to escape a boring Christmas with his in-laws. John Nettles and John Hopkins star, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Margery Mason.

programme.title: Coronation Street at Christmas
programme.desc: A look at the rich seam of Weatherfield's archive to showcase the stories that have entertained millions over the festive season for almost six decades - from weddings and babies to flings and fights, not forgetting those Christmas dinner-disasters and poignant goodbyes. Contributors including Barbara Knox, Chris Gascoyne, Jane Danson, William Roache, Sue Nicholls, Simon Gregson, Jack P Shepherd, Helen Flanagan, Thelma Barlow and Julie Goodyear share their memories of watching numerous, big Christmas storylines. Narrated by Sue Johnston.

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: Her Majesty's annual address to the nation and the people of the Commonwealth.

programme.title: Shrek the Halls
programme.desc: Festive animated short featuring the full whimsical cast of the hit film series. Shrek settles down for a quiet Christmas with Fiona and the babies, but Donkey and the ogre's other friends have their own ideas - and the party soon descends into chaos. Featuring the voices of Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz and Antonio Banderas.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: One of the most enjoyable things for viewers of The Chase is watching Bradley Walsh collapse in a fit of giggles after pronouncing a question wrong, or when a rude-sounding name crops up - or taking a contestant to one side to give them a telling-off if they get too big for their boots. Here, the host presents a third selection of these and other such unscripted moments and out-takes from the teatime quiz show.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.sub-title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars Christmas Special
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts a special seasonal edition of the quiz, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine in the hope of winning Â£20,000 for charity. This time, the famous faces taking part are comedian Joe Pasquale, TV personality Rustie Lee, and actress Nina Wadia.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.sub-title: The Chase Celebrity Christmas Day Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a festive episode in which celebrity contestants presenter Kate Thornton, reality star James Argent, comedian Lucy Porter and presenter Nik Speakman pit their wits against all five Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: While someone gets a Christmas morning doorstep surprise, Kim has malicious intent, and Graham's mood darkens.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary's stunned to find the furniture shop door open, and the gun and its ammunition missing. A worse-for-wear Derek lurches into the Rovers looking for Windass, pulls out a gun and fires a shot. Shona's plan for David's treasure hunt is soon forgotten when she and the Platts find themselves in the middle of a shootout. And while Seb comes to a decision about his future with Emma, Michelle puts her affairs in order as she makes plans to leave Weatherfield.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special

Sports presenter Clare Balding, actor Stephen Mangan and Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley each sit in the hot-seat, hoping to win Â£1million for their chosen charities, and as usual they will have four lifelines to help them along the way - Ask the Audience, 50:50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Christmas Road Trip - Three Unwise Men
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix reconvene after their European travels to rediscover the spirit of Christmas, heading to the unlikely festive destination of Morocco to see what the North African country has to offer in the way of culture, cuisine and adventure. The trio journey through the Agafay desert by camel, on through the mountains and end up deep in Marrakesh's marketplace and souks, with their trip culminating in a festive feast inspired by their travels, the people they have met and the experiences they have had.

programme.title: Four Christmases (2008)
programme.desc: A couple have always managed to avoid family festivities by travelling overseas. However, when their flight is cancelled, each of their divorced parents insists they spend yuletide with them - forcing the pair to get through a quartet of Christmas celebrations on the same day. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn and Reese Witherspoon.

programme.title: Britain's Top 100 Dogs: 2019
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Sara Cox count down the nation's favourite dog breeds, with the top 10 decided by a public vote. The programme features fascinating facts about the heritage, key characteristics and personality traits of every breed in the top 100 chart, as well as a host of famous faces - including Harry Redknapp, Penny Lancaster, Gemma Atkinson and Martin and Shirley Kemp - sharing stories about their bond with their four-legged friends. There are also funny and heartwarming dog-related stories from across the country.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV singers and vocal coaches Carrie and David Grant are today's VIP cooks, providing the food for Team Uniform - comprising a policeman, a vicar, a fireman and a midwife - who have to guess their identities with the help of a few cryptic clues. If the guests are successful, they will be one step closer to winning the full cash prize - but if they fail, they will be the ones doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

He also takes a trip to the villa where Ian Fleming created James Bond.

With analysis from Ruby Walsh and AP McCoy, reports by Mick Fitzgerald, Luke Harvey, Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point

programme.desc: James Bond pursues a mysterious criminal mastermind who has orchestrated a terrorist attack on MI6 headquarters and exposed the identities of undercover agents around the world. Sam Mendes directs the 23rd instalment in the spy franchise, starring Daniel Craig as 007, with Javier Bardem, Judi Dench, Ralph Fiennes, Naomie Harris and Ben Whishaw.

Is blacksmith's daughter Rose Wilton seeking revenge from beyond the grave, or will Barnaby and sidekick Charlie Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder? Starring Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee, with Fiona Dolman, Les Dennis, Elizabeth Berrington, Mark Heap, Emily Joyce, James Murray and Hannah Tointon.

Now, they must fight to stay together as they unravel the mystery surrounding Ego, a man who claims to be Quill's father. Writer/director James Gunn's follow up to his 2014 blockbuster, which reunites Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Karen Gillan and Dave Bautista, with support from Kurt Russell, Sylvester Stallone and Pom Klementieff. Bradley Cooper also provides the voice of Rocket and Vin Diesel is Groot.

programme.title: Cape Fear (1991)
programme.desc: A psychopathic rapist is released from prison after 14 years and plots revenge on the defence attorney he blames for his imprisonment. Subjecting the lawyer and his family to a terrifying campaign of intimidation, he uses his knowledge of the law to stay untouchable. Martin Scorsese's thriller remake, starring Robert De Niro, Nick Nolte, Jessica Lange and Juliette Lewis, with cameo appearances by Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam, who all appeared in the 1962 original.

programme.title: Animal Mums
programme.desc: How young animals copy their mother to learn new skills that are vital to keep them a live in the wild, including cheetah cubs learning how to hunt, with Liesl Eichenberger of the Sanbona Reserve in South Africa explaining the different stages of hunt school. Gorilla researcher Eva Maria Luef reveals the different gestures used to beg for food from their mother and initiate play, while Ellen Jackson at a stud farm in Sacramento talks about the close bond between horse foals and their mother, and how they learn to socialise and run with the herd. Narrated by Hugh Bonneville.

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Torvill & Dean
programme.desc: One-off drama following Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean's humble beginnings and family life in Nottingham, and how they came together to forge an ice-dancing partnership that would see them secure their place in sporting history with 12 perfect 6.0s at the 1984 Winter Olympics for their famous Bolero routine. Will Tudor and Poppy Lee Friar star as the duo, with Stephen Tompkinson, Anita Dobson, Dean Andrews, Jaime Winstone, Christine Bottomley, Annabelle Apsion and Jo Hartley.

programme.title: Knocked Up (2007)
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents-to-be decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Manchester's Olivia Davidson-Slack, and Will Oakley from Southampton take part in the dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby. Both Olivia and Will must decide which of three potential suitors they would like to accompany on a date, but must make their choice by interviewing their would-be sweetheart's families.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores Trinidad, where he visits a Hindu temple built on land reclaimed from the sea, prepares grilled tamarind tofu with callaloo pesto, and samples a local speciality - curried chickpeas in a fried bread roll. On a visit to Maracas Bay, he makes a coconut Caribbean chai.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts try to restore family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory in time for Christmas. Among the items is a Victorian version of a jukebox called a Polyphon, that has rusted into silence. It moves sisters Ann and Kathryn to tears when they hear it play the family's favourite carol for the first time in decades.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: The comedian, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Andy Parsons and Ed Byrne, oversees a clash between The Chase from Nuneaton and The Duke of Cambridge from Battersea.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Road-based cameras provide a convincing case for why two wheels are better than one, and traffic police face weird and wacky trouble.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road rage incidents in which drivers transformed highways into their own personal fight clubs. Plus, amateur wheel stunts that shun health and safety.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A tornado smashes into 40 houses, a massive explosion occurs at a propane plant, a truck crashes into a bridge resulting in a collapse, and a drag boat crashes.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of a train accident that led to huge explosions, a wall collapsing on top of firefighters, planes colliding on an aircraft carrier, a race-car crash and a sinking pier.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Sales supremo Mike Brewer has always wanted to have an old Caterham in the workshop, but mechanic Edd China decides to take a risk by painting it a shocking colour.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics help a man with a rare convertible that needs repairing.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Cruise ship the Norwegian Epic, and how a state-of-the-art navigation system keeps the enormous vessel on course.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Enormous cargo ship the North Star, which holds 600 storage containers and carries goods to and from Alaska.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: The crew of luxurious cruise liner Le Boreal braves ferocious weather conditions in Antarctica during its maiden voyage.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Supertanker Maersk Peregrino undergoes a transformation, becoming a floating oil production, storage and off-loading vessel - but its final journey to the oil fields may yet prove troublesome.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: The Umiak I, the world's most powerful ice-breaking carrier, and how it delivers supplies to a remote Canadian nickel factory and returns cargo worth more than Â£63million to the mainland.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: A weapons test aboard the guided missile destroyer USS Gravely takes a turn for the worse, and those who made it through the training drills are revealed.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Exploring the Beluga Bremen, the world's first multi-purpose heavy-lift cargo carrier.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: A look inside the Viking Longship Gefjon, a narrow cruiser that fits through tight locks, battles nasty weather and glides past stunning scenery, travelling from Budapest to Amsterdam.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: The crew of the Regal Princess, Princess Cruises' largest ship, faces narrow channels, shifting waters, shallow harbours, and transport vehicles.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: The MS Koningsdam, a Dutch cruise ship operated by Holland America Line, the first of its Pinnacle-class vessels.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: A look at the Viking Star's Scandinavian decor, delicious food and beautiful route. It embarks from Spain going through Europe and completes its journey in Norway.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: A look at life on board the Marina, Oceania Cruises' largest ship, which makes a 12-day, five port voyage. Its mobility lets it glide through narrow channels, steer into tight ports and carry 1,200 passengers.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: A crew of 2,200 on the Symphony of the Seas tends to more than 5,500 passengers as they sail to ports in France and Italy. As of 2019 it is the largest passenger ship in the world by gross tonnage.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: Deadliest Catch: Scariest Moments at Sea
